verses.text: 耶穌被押交彼拉多一到清晨，祭司長和長老、經學家以及公議會全體一致議決，把耶穌綁起來，押去交給彼拉多。

words.note: Combines 'escort' and 'hand over'
Refers to respected leaders, especially in religious contexts.
Refers to Jewish scholars and teachers of the Law.
The supreme Jewish judicial and administrative council.

verses.text: 彼拉多問他：「你是猶太人的王嗎？」耶穌回答：「你已經說了（「你已經說了」或譯「這是你說的」）。

words.note: Lit. 'Judea people'

verses.text: 祭司長控告了他許多事。
彼拉多又問他：「你看，他們控告你這麼多的事！你甚麼都不回答嗎？」

words.note: Often used in negative constructions to mean 'anything at all'.

verses.text: 耶穌還是一言不答，使彼拉多非常驚奇。

words.note: An idiom meaning 'to remain silent'.
Lit. 'not ordinary', meaning 'extraordinary' or 'very'.

verses.text: 彼拉多判耶穌釘十字架每逢這節期，彼拉多按著眾人所要求的，照例給他們釋放一個囚犯。

words.note: Lit. 'ten-character frame' or 'cross-shaped frame'.
Refers to the Passover festival.
Used to nominalize a verb phrase.

verses.text: 有一個人名叫巴拉巴，和作亂的人囚禁在一起，他們作亂的時候，曾殺過人。

words.note: Verb + aspect particle indicating past experience.

verses.text: 群眾上去，要求彼拉多援例給他們辦理。

words.note: Often paired with `上` to mean 'go up'.

words.definition: to cite a custom, apply precedent
words.note: To follow a established custom or rule.

verses.text: 彼拉多回答他們：「你們要我給你們釋放這個猶太人的王嗎？」

words.note: Refers to the Jewish people.

verses.text: 他知道祭司長是因為嫉妒才把耶穌交了來。

words.note: Refers to the leaders of the priests.
Introduces the direct object before the verb.
Used with `交` to indicate bringing something/someone here.

verses.text: 祭司長卻煽動群眾，寧可要總督釋放巴拉巴給他們。

words.note: Lit. 'priest-chief'.
Refers to a high-ranking official, often in colonial contexts.

verses.text: 彼拉多又對他們說：「那麼，你們稱為猶太人的王的，你們要我怎樣處置他呢？」

words.note: Refers to the people of Judea or those of Jewish faith.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase 'the one you call the king of the Jews'.

verses.text: 他們就喊著說：「把他釘十字架！」

words.note: 著 (zhe) indicates an action in progress.
Introduces the object before the verb, emphasizing its disposal.
Verb-object compound: 'nail to a cross'.

verses.text: 彼拉多說：「他作了甚麼惡事呢？」眾人卻更加大聲喊叫：「把他釘十字架！」

words.note: Often combined with 更 (gèng) to mean 'even more so'.

verses.text: 彼拉多有意討好群眾，就釋放了巴拉巴給他們，把耶穌鞭打了，交給他們釘十字架。

words.note: Implies a deliberate intention or desire.
Indicates completed action.
Refers to a severe beating with a whip.

verses.text: 士兵戲弄耶穌士兵把耶穌帶進總督府的院子裡，召集了全隊士兵。

words.note: Indicates direct object before verb
Refers to the Praetorium

verses.text: 他們給他披上紫色的外袍，又用荊棘編成冠冕給他戴上；
就向他祝賀說：「猶太人的王萬歲！」

words.note: An ancient imperial salute

verses.text: 又用一根蘆葦打他的頭，向他吐唾沫，並且跪下來拜他。
他們戲弄完了，就把他的紫色的外袍脫下，給他穿回自己的衣服，帶他出去，要釘十字架。

words.note: Indicates direct object before verb
Lit. 'ten-character frame', referring to the shape of the character '十'

verses.text: 耶穌被釘十字架有一個古利奈人西門，就是亞歷山大和魯孚的父親，從鄉下來到，經過那裡，士兵就強迫他背著耶穌的十字架。

words.note: A common biblical compound verb meaning 'to nail on the cross'.
Lit. 'cross-shaped frame'.

verses.text: 他們把耶穌帶到各各他地方（這地名譯出來就是「髑髏地」），
拿沒藥調和的酒給他，他卻不接受。

breakdown.m: immerse (mò in this context, not méi 'not')

words.note: A fragrant gum resin used for perfume, medicine, and embalming.

verses.text: 他們就把他釘了十字架；又抽籤分他的衣服，看誰得著甚麼。

words.note: Verb '釘' (to nail) followed by perfective particle '了' and object '十字架' (cross).

verses.text: 他們釘他十字架的時候，是在上午九點鐘。

words.note: Connects a modifying clause to a noun, similar to 'when' or 'that'.

verses.text: 耶穌的罪狀牌上寫著「猶太人的王」。

words.note: A tablet stating the charges against the condemned.

verses.text: 他們又把兩個強盜和他一同釘十字架，一個在右，一個在左。

words.note: Lit. 'nail the cross'; functions as one verbal unit meaning 'to crucify'.

verses.text: （有些抄本有第28節：「這就應驗了經上所說的：『他和不法者同列。』」）
過路的人譏笑他，搖著頭說：「哼，你這個要拆毀聖所，三日之內又把它建造起來的，

words.note: Combines 'pass by' and 'person' to mean 'passers-by'.
Verb with a compound directional complement indicating completion.

verses.text: 從十字架上把自己救下來吧！」

words.note: Verb with a compound directional complement indicating movement downwards.

verses.text: 祭司長和經學家也同樣譏笑他，彼此說：「他救了別人，卻不能救自己；

words.note: Refers to the head of the priestly class.
Literally 'scripture scholar'.

verses.text: 以色列的王基督啊，現在可以從十字架上下來，讓我們看見就信吧。」那和他同釘十字架的人也侮辱他。

words.note: Lit. 'cross-shaped frame'.
Combines 'from above' and 'come down'.
A verb-complement structure meaning 'to look and perceive'.
Lit. 'cross-shaped frame'.

verses.text: 耶穌死時的情形從正午到下午三點鐘，遍地都黑暗了。

words.note: Common way to express time, '三點' (sāndiǎn) also works.
Often used in biblical contexts to mean 'the whole earth/land'.
Indicates a change of state or completion of action.

verses.text: 下午三點的時候，耶穌大聲呼號：「以羅伊，以羅伊，拉馬撒巴各大尼？」這句話譯出來就是：「我的 神，我的 神，你為甚麼離棄我？」

words.note: Literally 'big voice', used adverbially.
Aramaic for 'my God'.
Aramaic for 'my God'.
Aramaic for 'why have you forsaken me?'
Verb-complement structure, meaning 'to translate and bring out'.
Refers to the Almighty God, hence capitalized.
Refers to the Almighty God, hence capitalized.
Often used in religious or formal contexts.

verses.text: 有些站在旁邊的人聽見了就說：「看，他呼叫以利亞呢。」

words.note: Verb-complement-particle structure, 'to listen and perceive'.
Softens tone, or indicates surprise/question.

verses.text: 有一個人跑去拿海綿浸滿了酸酒，綁在蘆葦上，遞給他喝，說：「等一等，我們看看以利亞來不來救他。」

words.note: Refers to the sour wine or vinegar offered to Jesus.
Reduplication indicates a brief or casual action.
A-not-A question structure.

verses.text: 耶穌大叫一聲，氣就斷了。

words.note: In this context, refers to breath or life force.

verses.text: 聖所裡的幔子，從上到下裂成兩半。
站在他對面的百夫長，看見他這樣斷氣，就說：「這人真是 神的兒子！」

words.note: A Roman army officer commanding 100 men.
Refers to the moment of death.
The space often indicates reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 也有些婦女遠遠地觀看，她們之中有抹大拉的馬利亞，小雅各和約西的母親馬利亞，以及撒羅米。

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes the distance.
As in Mary Magdalene, from Magdala.

verses.text: 這些婦女，當耶穌在加利利的時候，就一直跟隨他、服事他。此外，還有許多和他一同上耶路撒冷的婦女。

words.note: Indicates consequence or immediacy

verses.text: 耶穌葬在墳墓裡到了晚上，因為是預備日，就是安息日的前一日，

words.note: Refers to the day before the Sabbath or a major festival.
Lit. 'rest day'.

verses.text: 一個一向等候 神國度的尊貴的議員，亞利馬太的約瑟來了，就放膽地進去見彼拉多，求領耶穌的身體。

words.note: Honorific space commonly used before '神' (God) in Chinese Bibles.
Indicates consequence or immediacy

verses.text: 彼拉多驚訝耶穌已經死了，就叫百夫長前來，問他耶穌是不是死了很久。

words.note: Indicates consequence or immediacy
Lit. 'hundred-man chief'.
Forms an A-not-A question '是不是' (is it or is it not?)

verses.text: 他從百夫長知道了實情以後，就把屍體給了約瑟。

words.note: Lit. 'hundred-man chief'.
Indicates consequence or immediacy
Used to prepose the object of a verb

verses.text: 約瑟買了細麻布，把耶穌取下，用細麻布裹好，安放在一個從磐石鑿出來的墳墓裡，又輥過一塊石頭來擋住墓門。
抹大拉的馬利亞和約西的母親馬利亞都看見安放他的地方。
